channel.title: Windows on Some Title
channel.description: Recent content in Windows on Some Title

item.title: Hit the ISE ERS API with PowerShell
item.description: #Introduction If you want to operate the API easily, I think that you often use cURL, Postman, HTTP Client provided in various programming languages, etc., but there are cases where such an environment cannot be prepared due to various restrictions. Is it not? In this post, we will introduce the API of Cisco Identity Services Engine (ISE) as a minimum to operate the REST API with a Windows terminal (PowerShell).

item.title: How to use Google Colaboratory
item.description: ![image.png](https://qiita-image-store.s3.ap-northeast-1.amazonaws.com/0/587891/ed416201-d330-975f-0707-cea8dd90ab29.png) Purpose Google Colaboratory can be used. Please see How to use Google Colaboratory for detailed explanation and code.

item.title: Delete tweets for specified period
item.description: ## I want to say that there was no black history There are already various tools in the world, According to the specifications of Twitter, only the latest 3200 can be deleted, There is a charge for mass deletion. Very troubled. There are over 100,000 tweets like garbage that have accumulated since 2010. There is also a source that erases all tweets in Qiita if you search for it. But everything is in trouble.

item.title: Build Tello_Video environment on Windows
item.description: #Introduction This page is Run Tello-Python sample “Tello_Video” This is a supplementary page of. Or not only for “Tello_Video”, If you want to do “Tello-Python” on Windows, you need to do this first, including installing Python. #Overview Of the DJI official Python sample program for Tello “Tello-Python”, Tello_Video In order to try Installation of various dependent libraries Should do git Tello-Python page ãƒ»Windows Go to the "install\Windows" folder,select and run the correct "windows_install.

item.title: [Python] Expand escape sequences in here-docs
item.description: I'm addicted to it Even if the escape sequence (\) is written in the here-document as it is, it is not expanded as an escape sequence. It can be expanded by writing two consecutive characters like \\ or using a raw string. >>> import json >>> >>> json_dict1 = json.loads(''' ... { ... "id": 1, ... "name": "hoge", ... "discription": "Houji \"Hojo \ "Hoge" ...} ...''') Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 7, in <module> File "C:\Program Files\WindowsApps\PythonSoftwareFoundation.
